TopicTitle: Just 7 days til launch! Watch the first preview video of...

Articles.Content:
> 
> With such a short video, you could have done a Vine. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Except we don't have vines, or whatever you're talking about.

Although it would have been great to also show her climbing up a ladder and then clambering over the edge since they're currently unable to really do that.

> 
> I'm not against clambering but did we need clambering? It's not something I've thought about for KSP or ever heard anyone talk about. I've never even seen a situation where clambering would be used. Except when I make an early space plane before ladders are researched so I need to drop the landing gear to get low enough so I can get back on board. Sometimes that can be awkward without clambering.
> I'm not going to complain about making the small improvements though. It's a quality of life change which though small will be nice to have.

Clambering will help to get rid of the requirement of ladders that curve to above the platform the kerbal is trying to get to.

> 
> I'm not against clambering but did we need clambering? It's not something I've thought about for KSP or ever heard anyone talk about. I've never even seen a situation where clambering would be used. Except when I make an early space plane before ladders are researched so I need to drop the landing gear to get low enough so I can get back on board. Sometimes that can be awkward without clambering.
> I'm not going to complain about making the small improvements though. It's a quality of life change which though small will be nice to have.

Yes we needed it. There is nothing quite as frustrating as placing your ladder 1 micron too low and the stupid Kerbal won't climb up on to the cockpit of the plane. Especially problematic since they redid the Mk1 Cockpit model. Those air intake looking things that aren't actually air intakes make it hard to get the ladder just right.

Its the 27th.

When someone says something says "7 days until..." something, they mean it'll be in 7 days. Not 8. 7 days from the 20th is the 7th.

If it helps, count down:

On the 20th, you have 7 days until the 27th.

On the 21st, you have 6 days until the 27th.

On the 22nd, you have 5 days until the 27th.

On the 23rd, you have 4 days until the 27th.

On the 24th, you have 3 days until the 27th.

On the 25th, you have 2 days until the 27th.

On the 26th, you have 1 day until the 27th.
In just seven days...I can make you a ma-a-a-a-an!
